trans-unit.source: Represents the base class for communicating with an XML Web service using the simple HTTP-GET and HTTP-POST protocols bindings.
This class specifies most of the implementation for communicating with an XML Web service over HTTP using encoders to encode the parameters and return values into common MIME formats.
These encoders derive from the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.MimeFormatter> class.

By default, a proxy class deriving from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol> encodes parameters using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded MIME type and the response in plain XML.

Custom mime formatters can be specified using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute> attribute, however, there is no support for integrating this into a service description and proxy generation.
`Notes to Inheritors:` When you override this class, you can introduce methods in the derived class that are specific to a particular type of an XML Web service.
The methods simply capture the parameters, and call the base class to do the work of communicating with the site.

If the introduced methods are asynchronous, call the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.BeginInvoke%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.EndInvoke%2A> methods.
If the introduced methods are synchronous, call the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.Invoke%2A> method.
The overridden constructor typically sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.WebClientProtocol.Url%2A> property to the URI of the XML Web service method.
The Web Services Description Language tool (Wsdl.exe) generates derived classes of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol> for a given Service Description.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol"></xref> class.
Starts an asynchronous invocation of a method of an XML Web service.

The `methodName` parameter is used to find the types of the parameters and return values of the method that is invoking the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.BeginInvoke%2A> method.
It is also used to find custom attributes that may have been added to the method.

<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute>, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute>, and <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute> provide additional information on the derived method that is required for the HTTP protocol.
`asyncState` is passed into `callback` and is included in the <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that is returned from the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.BeginInvoke%2A> method.
It is useful for passing information from the context of the asynchronous call to the handling of the asynchronous result in `callback`.
The name of the XML Web service method.
The URL to use when creating the <xref href="System.Net.WebRequest"></xref>.
An array of objects containing the parameters to pass to the XML Web service method.
The order of the values in the array corresponds to the order of the parameters in the calling method of the derived class.
The delegate to call when the asynchronous method call is complete.
If callback is `null`, the delegate is not called.
The additional information supplied by a client.

An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that can be passed to the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.EndInvoke(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method to obtain the return values from the XML Web service method.
The request reached the server computer, but was not processed successfully.
Completes asynchronous invocation of an XML Web service method using HTTP.

The <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> returned from the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.BeginInvoke(System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method.
An array of objects containing the return value and any by reference or out parameters for the XML Web service method.
asyncResult is not the return value from the method.
Invokes an XML Web service method using HTTP.

The `methodName` parameter is used to find the types of the parameters and return values of the method that is invoking the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.Invoke%2A> method.
It is also used to find custom attributes which may have been added to the method.

<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute> and <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute> provide additional information on the derived method that is required for the SOAP protocol.

The name of the XML Web service method in the derived class that is invoking the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpSimpleClientProtocol.Invoke(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])"></xref> method.
The URL of the XML Web service method that the client is requesting.
An array of objects containing the parameters to pass to the remote XML Web service.
The order of the values in the array corresponds to the order of the parameters in the calling method of the derived class.
An array of objects containing the return value and any by-reference or out parameters of the derived class method.
The request reached the server computer, but was not processed successfully.
Invokes the specified method asynchronously.
The name of the method to invoke.
The request URL of the invoked web service.
The parameters to pass to the method.
The delegate called when the method invocation has completed.
Invokes the specified method asynchronously while maintaining an associated state.
The name of the method to invoke.
The request URL of the invoked web service.
The parameters to pass to the method.
The delegate called when the method invocation has completed.
An object containing associated state information that is passed to the callback delegate when the method has completed.
